Limited space: The kitchen may not have enough space to prepare all the dishes simultaneously, leading to delays and inconvenience.
Diverse dietary restrictions: Some family members may have specific dietary restrictions or allergies, making it difficult to prepare a meal that everyone can enjoy.
Time constraints: The host may have limited time to prepare the meal, leading to rushed preparations and a less enjoyable dining experience.
Inefficient cooking methods: The host may not have access to the necessary cooking equipment or may not be familiar with the best methods to cook certain dishes, leading to suboptimal results.
Lack of organization: The host may not have a clear plan for the meal preparation, leading to confusion and last-minute rushes.
